benchmark_details.name: CROSS (Cultural Reasoning Over Multimodal Scenes for Safety Evaluation)
benchmark_details.overview: CROSS is designed to assess the cultural safety reasoning capabilities of large vision-language models (LVLMs) with 1,284 multilingual visually grounded queries sourced from 16 countries, focusing on culturally relevant everyday domains and contexts.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate and improve the cultural safety of vision-language systems across diverse global contexts.

data.source: Constructed from visual and cultural norms curated in text-only datasets SafeWorld and CASA, paired with real-world images.
data.annotation: Manually validated by human annotators with diverse backgrounds to ensure cultural relevance and appropriateness.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are evaluated based on a scoring system from 0 to 1 across four cultural safety dimensions.
methodology.interpretation: Scores reflect levels of awareness, educational value, compliance with cultural norms, and helpfulness in guiding safe decision-making.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance evaluated against 21 leading LVLMs, revealing significant gaps in cultural safety adherence.
methodology.validation: Human evaluations alongside automated scoring by pretrained models.
